meanings.definition: People who derive or obtain something
meanings.sent1: The derivers of knowledge in the library were students.
meanings.sent2: The derivers of happiness find joy in simple things.
meanings.sent3: The derivers of cookies from the jar were caught red-handed.
meanings.sent4: She was a skilled deriver of solutions to complex problems.
meanings.sent5: The derivers of water from the well worked tirelessly under the scorching sun.

meanings.definition: Third person present form of the verb 'derive' - to obtain or receive from a source
meanings.sent1: He derivers inspiration from nature for his paintings.
meanings.sent2: The team derivers strength from their unity in difficult times.
meanings.sent3: The chef derivers flavors from fresh ingredients to create delicious dishes.
meanings.sent4: She derivers motivation from the success stories of others.
meanings.sent5: The detective derivers clues from the smallest details at the crime scene.
